message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the importance of measurement in network protocols and proposes the inclusion of measurability as a low-level goal in protocol design. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also touches upon security and optimization, which could place it in the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) categories. The proposal for generalizing the idea of measurement within protocols could also relate to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) category. Finally, the paper discusses the need for diagnostic support in the network stack, which could place it in the cs.SE (Software Engineering) category.
